title: Braum's passive can't work on you for 8 seconds if he gets 4 stacks
body:
But Bro Kench gets 3 stacks,stuns you,spits you into his team and rinse repeat instantly all while having the damage to kill you himself as tank support...i dont understand?
And yes i know braums team can help stack
but tahms team will help kill
not to mention after the stun all tahm's stacks remain
EDIT: Didn't expect this to get upvoted,lets see some more discussions

replies.body: Tahm doesn't have a giant Teamfight ult that knocks people up and then creates a slow field (Rumbles love it), Braum's passive can also be used to stun people simultaneously, while Tahm must go from one to the other.
dont forget the shield that blocks projectiles and reduces the rest with ms boost, the escape to a unit jump giving others mr and armor, and the mustache, cant forget that.
I don't know why you bother mentioning all that garbage. His facial hair is clearly his greatest strength and the only thing worth bringing up.
Its not quite the same tier, but do remember Tahm does have a moustache of his own. Albeit a fishy one, but still.

Braum doesn't have a 32% max health damage skill that also CC's the enemy giving them no vision or really counterplay but for "Don't go near him with max stacks". Not to mention Tahm also has his E which either is good for sustain or practically a free 2nd health bar.

Braum's passive can't apply on the same target for a certain amount of time and while it's true that allies can help stack it, what's annoying is the fact that as a support, Tahm just does way to much damage. If you're the adc and you run into their support Tahm you're basically dead because he can solo you (unless you're insanely fed..). You can't escape from him, and with a bit of CDR you might get hit by his devour 2 times in a 1v1 fight which...was basically 64% of your max health from a full tank support..

At least with Braum you can escape from since his stun has a CD between them and after his stun + ult which doesn't do a lot of damage, you only have to worry about dodging his slow from his Q. Also unlike TK, Braum can't really add stacks on you from range but for his Q which can be blocked my minions. TK can use his Q (which deals more damage and has less CD than Braum's Q) and can spit minions at you for stacks which has a very large aoe range, so hiding behind minions won't help all the time.
its almost like they're different champions and comparing a kit-wide mechanic against a single ability isn't effective huh?

It's a bit silly to compare 2 champions for balance purpose, granted. But for both of them, their stacks are a "kit-wide" mechanic. Braum Q applies a stack, and it's whole offense side revolves around "how can I proc my stacks?". I love to jump on a minion that the ADC is last hitting and surprise him with an AA :)

I don't think having 1 ability that interacts with the passive really makes it "kit-wide." To be fair, Tahm only has 2, but that's still twice as much as Braum, plus Tahm has more complex interactions. I guess Tahm can use his ult to get in range to proc his passive and his E allows him to get close to proc the passive without worrying about dying, but I think if you look beyond direct interactions boots will interact with most abilities.

That's all besides the point though. Whether it's "kit-side" or not, comparing parts of 2 champions (because really, the OP isn't even trying to compare Braum and Tahm, just their stack mechanics) is not a good way to understand the game.
It's not about Braum having a longer cooldown for his passive. It's about Tahm Kench becoming an AP assassin by building full tank.

Considering that his Q is on a 6 second CD (or 3.6 with max cdr) and cost very low amount of mana, even if you weren't predictable...one of those Q's will hit you and if you get hit it's very easy for him to get those stacks on you since his melee range is higher than most other melee champions and you were just hit by a 70% slow.

Basically if you're up against a top lane TK, unless you're playing a range champion, or a melee champion with a lot of mobility...he will easily stun-devour you for more than half your HP, and then just wait 6-10 seconds and repeat to finish you off. Also about when you mentioned about "practically no ultimate" yes technically in a 1v1, or 2v2 fight you don't officially have a usable ultimate for that fight...but it's the same situations with {{champion:80}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:4}} they also don't have an ultimate you can use in a 1v1 fight since it's about using it to help out another lane and create an advantage in the fight with them. 

Which I do find it funny that TK's ultimate is longer range, and way less CD than Twisted Fate...Considering that's basically what makes TF is the fact he can just ult in and create an advantage from his teleport, and yet this random support has a better version and one that can even bring in another team member to teleport 2 people...But I know, before you say it "Now you're comparing a Mid-lane mage/assassin to Tahm Kench!" I'm not comparing them themselves just pointing out that his ultimate is the same or better than twisted fate's considering that TF's teleport is what makes him TF.

tl;dr - No matter how "good" you are, one of his Q's would prob hit you and he can very easily Stun-Devour you for about half or more HP and repeat again. Having no combat ultimate doesn't instantly make his damage "fair" since other champions are the same.

Q is cc, W is cc or save an ally, E is a 2ndary health bar or sustain and R is just positioning. Tanks, whether immobile or not, shouldn't be dealing a lot of damage, there's a good reason why Juggernauts/some Bruisers with that damage will not have any hard cc and very little utility. It's stupid to allow a champion to have high durability, good damage, a lot off cc and a lot of utility. He also does their level of damage without even building a single half offensive items, at least bruisers have to build BC/SG, Tahm skips all that and builds boots+5 defensive items.

Just because Riot said it's justified doesn't mean it is, especially when it contradicts what they said about champions like Garen, who was seen as "very sticky", Tahm can stick to a target with higher reliability while allowing his entire team to catch up to the target where as champions like Garen only allow themselves to stay on the target leaving their team behind. Also its funny to hear people say just because the creators said something means its correct. Whats goes is what the overall customer base says.

Tomorrow literally a huge majority of the playerbase can all start saying delete Tahm Kench or we will leave LoL(And I mean actually do it, not the lol quitting league threads that people post here and still play that very day) and once Riot sees they aren't kidding and they are losing millions of people in rapid succession, they will do it. They would have no choice.

I know that is an extreme example but that is how businesses work. They make the ideas and maintain whatever their product is, but the consumer is the one that tells which direction it goes else all the maker's work is for nothing. 

I mean hell, simplier example if you won't listen to that is Blitzcrank. He was orginally meant to be a top laner, a fighter that can help the team as well with his grab. People made him a support and said he was a support. So Riot changed him to being a support.

Show those cows a proper replacement then to leave for.  You know, how a Capitalist society works?  Cause all I hear is an empty threat.

There is nothing wrong with conditional 32% max health damage when it's gated that much.  Know who else can do 32% of your max health with a similar amount of conditions?  Just about every mage.  Dodge Morgana's binding.  Don't get the space aids on you.  Don't stand on top of Ekko's chronoshift destination.  And don't make us bring up supports like Annie or Velkoz, who have such small gates on their burst it's ridiculous.

And before you even bring up dueling a toplane or jungle Kench, how come you have champions you're not supposed to duel but you can't count Kench as one?  How come you don't count Yasuo as a champion you're ill-advised to duel alone?  Yi?  Darius?  Fiora?  Gangplank?  Garen?  Nasus?  Tryndamere?  Renekton?  What about champions on the other end of the spectrum of "don't duel this alone"?  Malphite?  Rammus?  Mundo?  Maokai?  Sion?

But I'm sure you'd accept there's champions you don't have to duel in lane.  How come complaints about Kench are always centered around the presumption that you HAVE to fight him?

Play some goddamned Nasus, get some perspective.  You don't have to make flashy plays to win.

No, the real reason you can't re-apply stack is not because of 5-man stuns, it's the opposite. If you could re-apply stacks immediately, you could chain-stun anyone in 1v1 or 2v2 scenarios.

The point still remains the same though.

Tahm can chain his passive because he is the only one who can proc it (also it doesnt stun automatically on third stack, he needs his Q for that).

Whereas Braum's is any ally, and given that he is teamed up with someone building attack speed, chaining his stun would be ungodly.

My husband plays Tahm support a lot. From him I learned:

He was not happy to see the movement speed boost with ally swallowed go. This hinders support Kench.

He doesn't get why he does so much % max health damage. He would rather keep the utility to see this decreased.

He has told me the main problem with his stickiness is that the stacks do not disappear after you are eaten. Typically, stacks go back to zero after a function like this. Even without a timer. After braums stun, you don't remain at 4 stacks; it's reset to zero. **With Tahm, he can stun them with Q (6 second CD), eat them for 6 seconds (6 second CD), spit them out, stun them with Q, etc.** The stacks never drop. He said it's stupid you can lock down a mobile champion like Ahri with a tank that has obscene CC and damage. He has 3v1 before on a support build and got a triple kill.

I think that if you use an empowered ability, the stacks should reset. So you eat them, spit them out, and then you have to put 3 more stacks on before you can eat again or stun.
You guys have such a hard-on for 1v1 champs... I hope Kench will still be playable after you get him nerfed 3 times.
